text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The ethnic Albanian Party of Democratic Prosperity in Macedonia, the government's coalition partner, will boycott local elections this fall if the territorial division law is not amended to its liking, says party secretary-general Naser Ziberi in an exclusive interview.
- The government is striking back against cigarette smugglers in what will become a full anti-tax evasion campaign in September.
- Macedonia's produce farmers are forced to sell their products at ridiculously low prices. A ton of tomatoes sells for 4,000 denars ($100), and a ton of peppers for 5,000 ($125).

- Greek authorities once again painted over the name Macedonia on the local airline Palair Macedonia in a breach of the agreement on mutual undestanding signed by the two countries under U.N. and U.S. auspices. A similar incident occurred on July 17. -- Skopje newsroom +389 91 201196
